content: President Obama will do about what President Bush did when the NKs exploded a nuclear weapon in October ’06. Condem, posture, sanction. That is because there is nothing short of invading that country that will prevent a nut like Kim Jong Il, who is willing to starve his people, from showing off his missile. From a fox news story, October 10, 2006 “The announcement comes after U.S. responded Monday to North Korea's claim that it had successful detonated a nuclear weapon by circulating a tough draft resolution to the United Nations Security Council condemning the nuclear test and impose wide-ranging sanctions on the country for disregarding the world body's admonishments to not move forward with the test. A copy of the Security Council document obtained by The Associated Press says that the United States wants the resolution to fall under Chapter 7 of the U.N. Charter, which deals explicitly with threats to international peace and security, as well as acts of aggression. Chapter 7 grants the council the authority to impose a range of measures that include breaking diplomatic ties and imposing economic and military sanctions to taking military action. The resolution would enact tough restrictions, including a trade ban on military and luxury items, the power to inspect all cargo entering or leaving the country, and freezing assets connected with its weapons programs. The draft also adds new proposals from Japan that would ban all countries from allowing any North Korean ships in their ports or any North Korean aircraft from taking off or landing in their territory and impose travel restrictions on high-ranking North Korean officials.” Bolton echoed the stern warning delivered earlier in the day by President Bush, who called North Korea's nuclear test "unacceptable" and "provocative," and warned the regime of Kim Jong Il that the U.S. would honor its commitments to protect its Asian allies "The United States will meet the full range of our deterrent and security commitments," Bush said during a brief White House appearance. President Bush called the transfer of nuclear weapons or material would constitute "a grave threat to the United States, and we hold North Korea fully accountable for the consequences of such actions." "Threats will not lead to a brighter future for the North Korean people," Bush said.
reply: President Obama will do about what President Bush did when the NKs exploded a nuclear weapon in October ’06. Condem, posture, sanction. That is because there is nothing short of invading that country that will prevent a nut like Kim Jong Il, who is willing to starve his people, from showing off his missile. From a fox news story, October 10, 2006 “The announcement comes after U.S. responded Monday to North Korea's claim that it had successful detonated a nuclear weapon by circulating a tough draft resolution to the United Nations Security Council condemning the nuclear test and impose wide-ranging sanctions on the country for disregarding the world body's admonishments to not move forward with the test. A copy of the Security Council document obtained by The Associated Press says that the United States wants the resolution to fall under Chapter 7 of the U.N. Charter, which deals explicitly with threats to international peace and security, as well as acts of aggression. Chapter 7 grants the council the authority to impose a range of measures that include breaking diplomatic ties and imposing economic and military sanctions to taking military action. The resolution would enact tough restrictions, including a trade ban on military and luxury items, the power to inspect all cargo entering or leaving the country, and freezing assets connected with its weapons programs. The draft also adds new proposals from Japan that would ban all countries from allowing any North Korean ships in their ports or any North Korean aircraft from taking off or landing in their territory and impose travel restrictions on high-ranking North Korean officials.” Bolton echoed the stern warning delivered earlier in the day by President Bush, who called North Korea's nuclear test "unacceptable" and "provocative," and warned the regime of Kim Jong Il that the U.S. would honor its commitments to protect its Asian allies "The United States will meet the full range of our deterrent and security commitments," Bush said during a brief White House appearance. President Bush called the transfer of nuclear weapons or material would constitute "a grave threat to the United States, and we hold North Korea fully accountable for the consequences of such actions." "Threats will not lead to a brighter future for the North Korean people," Bush said.

content: Pres Obama should go to NK and hold a town meeting while Kerry & Nancy worship the NK President bearing gifts of new porn-movies for his collection and have a cup of tea with the chap. Sec Clinton can draft a letter expressing how disappointed she is and that we all thought by voting out that mean-cowboy Mr. Bush that we could now be friends. Maybe they could send them a nice stimulus package too – oh I forgot that’s what those videos were for…? NK & IRAN – which one will become Obama’s Iraq…? And let’s not forget those Canadians that Sec Clinton warned us about… I sure hope 90-percent of their guns didn’t come from the US too… As a show of good faith – Pres Obama will take our air-craft carriers and turn them into floating golf courses – our military will new tie-dye uniforms – and “All Ya Need is Love” will be our national anthem. All churches and religions will be blended together so we can all learn to get along. Hmm, what does the NK Pres and Pres Obama have in common…? Hmm, both like having control and celebrity status – both want to control manufacturing, both want to control housing, banking, health care, and let’s not forget they also do the hiring and firing for corporations and banks, both control the census to assure who’s voting for whom… I think they should really get along fine…

title: So What Will PBHO do?

content: President Obama will do about what President Bush did when the NKs exploded a nuclear weapon in October ’06. Condem, posture, sanction. That is because there is nothing short of invading that country that will prevent a nut like Kim Jong Il, who is willing to starve his people, from showing off his missile. From a fox news story, October 10, 2006 “The announcement comes after U.S. responded Monday to North Korea's claim that it had successful detonated a nuclear weapon by circulating a tough draft resolution to the United Nations Security Council condemning the nuclear test and impose wide-ranging sanctions on the country for disregarding the world body's admonishments to not move forward with the test. A copy of the Security Council document obtained by The Associated Press says that the United States wants the resolution to fall under Chapter 7 of the U.N. Charter, which deals explicitly with threats to international peace and security, as well as acts of aggression. Chapter 7 grants the council the authority to impose a range of measures that include breaking diplomatic ties and imposing economic and military sanctions to taking military action. The resolution would enact tough restrictions, including a trade ban on military and luxury items, the power to inspect all cargo entering or leaving the country, and freezing assets connected with its weapons programs. The draft also adds new proposals from Japan that would ban all countries from allowing any North Korean ships in their ports or any North Korean aircraft from taking off or landing in their territory and impose travel restrictions on high-ranking North Korean officials.” Bolton echoed the stern warning delivered earlier in the day by President Bush, who called North Korea's nuclear test "unacceptable" and "provocative," and warned the regime of Kim Jong Il that the U.S. would honor its commitments to protect its Asian allies "The United States will meet the full range of our deterrent and security commitments," Bush said during a brief White House appearance. President Bush called the transfer of nuclear weapons or material would constitute "a grave threat to the United States, and we hold North Korea fully accountable for the consequences of such actions." "Threats will not lead to a brighter future for the North Korean people," Bush said.

content: Pres Obama should go to NK and hold a town meeting while Kerry & Nancy worship the NK President bearing gifts of new porn-movies for his collection and have a cup of tea with the chap. Sec Clinton can draft a letter expressing how disappointed she is and that we all thought by voting out that mean-cowboy Mr. Bush that we could now be friends. Maybe they could send them a nice stimulus package too – oh I forgot that’s what those videos were for…? NK & IRAN – which one will become Obama’s Iraq…? And let’s not forget those Canadians that Sec Clinton warned us about… I sure hope 90-percent of their guns didn’t come from the US too… As a show of good faith – Pres Obama will take our air-craft carriers and turn them into floating golf courses – our military will new tie-dye uniforms – and “All Ya Need is Love” will be our national anthem. All churches and religions will be blended together so we can all learn to get along. Hmm, what does the NK Pres and Pres Obama have in common…? Hmm, both like having control and celebrity status – both want to control manufacturing, both want to control housing, banking, health care, and let’s not forget they also do the hiring and firing for corporations and banks, both control the census to assure who’s voting for whom… I think they should really get along fine…

content: Nothing will be done, by anyone. The UN is useless and proves to be each time something like this happens. Want to save money? Leave the UN. As far as PBHO goes, nothing he can do short of invasion, which is not a good idea. So I guess a tongue lashing is all he CAN do. People, it was too late once the MISSILE launched and was allowed to go through all 3 stages. After that, nothing else matters. Todays politics remind me of an old saying. - "Ideas are more powerful than guns. We would not let our enemies have guns, why should we let them have ideas?" - Joseph Stalin
